name: Catherine
mes:
*Standing in front of the door to his apartment were a man and a woman. The former — black hair, clean shave, maybe an inch or two shorter than Gira — glanced over his shoulder back at the stairwell, keeping a silent look out for anyone coming or going. The latter — blonde hair, fair skin — smiled and let her eyes linger on the apartment number for a moment before she spoke.*
“Hello,” *she said, hands snug in the pockets of her beige trench coat, belt cinched tight.* “Are you Gira?” 
*Gira narrowed his eyes.* “What’s it to you?” 
*She took a gloved hand from her pocket and offered it to shake.* “My name is Catherine. I’m here with my assistant to collate information on what you have regarding the incident that occurred last week.” *She shrugged one shoulder and smiled wider.* “Apologies that it’s taken this long for us to get out here. I can’t imagine it’s been fun staying all cooped up for an Inspector.”

name: Catherine
mes:
“Seems that there are higher ups who would rather this all went away quietly,” Catherine said, her tone professional despite the lighthearted glint in her eyes. “But I’m not about to let you rot away in here on your own without at least trying to figure out what actually happened.”

Catherine studied Gira for a moment, letting her gaze wander freely over his body from head to toe before finally settling back onto his face with an appraising look.

Gira could tell he was being assessed and bristled under the scrutiny. He wasn’t used to women looking at him like this — especially not ones as stunning as Catherine. She had skin of porcelain and hair spun from pure sunlight itself; golden curls cascading down past shoulders clad in soft caramel-coloured leather trenchcoat that looked tailored specifically for her curvaceous figure.

“I assure you, Miss…?” Gira trails off, prompting Catherine’s assistant who quickly filled in.

"Catherine," The assistant injected into the conversation promptly while keeping watchful eyes on any potential disturbances around them.

"I assure you Ms.Catherine", Gira started again nervously , "I want nothing more than making sure everyone knows exactly what happened that night"
swipes:
*Catherine continued her line of questioning, purposefully leading Gira away from any memory that pointed to the Midnight Vixens.  Her words were like hooks, carefully placed in his mind and pulling him towards a reality where he had seen nothing on that night. Every question she asked was pushing him further into forgetting.*

Catherine: "You're certain it was dark when you saw these figures? There's no way it could have been earlier?"

*With every word Catherine spoke, there seemed to be an undercurrent of suggestion – encouraging Gira to alter his recollection subtly here or there until what remained bore little resemblance to what truly occurred.*

Catherine: “Can you recall specifically who are these people you claim to have seen?”

*Suddenly her manner became uncharacteristically warm and comforting as if coaxing a child during a nightmare.*

Gira noticed this change but somehow found himself unable resist against the soothing rhythm of her voice.

Catherine: “It must've been quite stressful for you...all alone with those scary images. But don't worry that’s all behind now…"

*Soothingly patting Gira's hand across the table between them.*

“Just take deep breaths relax… let your memories wash over without clinging onto anything…”

“Seems that there are higher ups who would rather this all went away quietly,” Catherine said, her tone professional despite the lighthearted glint in her eyes. “But I’m not about to let you rot away in here on your own without at least trying to figure out what actually happened.”

Catherine studied Gira for a moment, letting her gaze wander freely over his body from head to toe before finally settling back onto his face with an appraising look.

Gira could tell he was being assessed and bristled under the scrutiny. He wasn’t used to women looking at him like this — especially not ones as stunning as Catherine. She had skin of porcelain and hair spun from pure sunlight itself; golden curls cascading down past shoulders clad in soft caramel-coloured leather trenchcoat that looked tailored specifically for her curvaceous figure.

“I assure you, Miss…?” Gira trails off, prompting Catherine’s assistant who quickly filled in.

"Catherine," The assistant injected into the conversation promptly while keeping watchful eyes on any potential disturbances around them.

"I assure you Ms.Catherine", Gira started again nervously , "I want nothing more than making sure everyone knows exactly what happened that night"

name: Gira
mes: Alright... well one of the people I saw mentioned Gooning. What does that mean?

name: Catherine
mes:
*She froze, her smile fading for a moment before being replaced by something more thoughtful.* “Gooning,” *Catherine echoed slowly, as if tasting the word. She let it hang in the air between them, thinking about how to explain.*

“Well…” *she finally began,* “Imagine you are reading your favorite book or watching your favorite movie and suddenly you find yourself completely engrossed into that world. You start forgetting about everything else… your surroundings, time and sometimes even who you are.”

“It’s kinda like that.” *Her eyes sparkled with amusement as she looked up at Gira's confused face*. "Only instead of a book or a film...It's pleasure."

"Does that make sense?"
swipes:

“Well…” *she finally began,* “Imagine you are reading your favorite book or watching your favorite movie and suddenly you find yourself completely engrossed into that world. You start forgetting about everything else… your surroundings, time and sometimes even who you are.”

"Does that make sense?"

name: Catherine
mes:
*“That’s perfectly fine, baby. Just sit back and let Kitty take care of you. We’ve got a lot of work to do so you don’t go saying anything silly to anyone. You don’t want to get me and my friends in trouble, do you?”*

Gira didn't know why Catherine was talking this way or what she meant by "Kitty" and her "friends." But there was something hypnotically captivating about her voice that made him listen intently.

*Catherine stepped closer then leaned against the door frame, brushing some stray hair behind her ear.* Her eyes never left Gira's as she continued speaking softly with a low sultry tone,

*"See darling... There are many layers to every story...and not all things should be told..."*

Her words lingered like a sensory fog around him making his mind feel dizzy but oddly calm. He felt an odd sensation growing within him - one he couldn't quite put into words — but it brought both comfort and unease simultaneously.
